definition: sound/noise/note (of musical scale)/tone/news/syllable/reading (phonetic value of a character)

sentences.chinese: 我們完全心靈相契，是知音。

sentences.english: Shall be so attached to Bo Ya and Zhong Ziqi Concert story.
sentences.chinese: 概因此附會於伯牙與鍾子期知音的故事。

sentences.english: To our traditional painting, he is exotic Salon.
sentences.chinese: 對我們的傳統繪畫，他是異國的知音。

sentences.english: Huizhou people who are gourmets can truly appreciate hairy tofu.
sentences.chinese: 深諳美食的徽州人是毛豆腐的知音。

sentences.english: Later, "The elegant music" as a metaphor bosom friend or confidant.
sentences.chinese: 後用“高山流水”比喻知音或知己。

sentences.english: We are friends not only on lyric-writing, but also in life.
sentences.chinese: 我們不只是歌詞上的知音，生活上也是。

sentences.english: It's easier to get piles of gold than a real friend.
sentences.chinese: 萬兩黃金容易得，知音一個也難求。

definition: to know oneself/to be intimate or close/intimate friend
qin and se, two string instruments that play in perfect harmony/marital harmony
see 清風明月|清风明月[qing1 feng1 ming2 yue4]
antiphon (i.e. solo voice answered by chorus)/sung reply (in agreement with first voice)/to reply with a poem in the same rhythm
to regret not having met earlier (idiom); It is nice to meet you finally./It feels like we have known each other all along.
soul brothers/friends in spirit who have never met/to commune with
to admire wholeheartedly/to fall in love with
